p: It was observed that the most of the potential antifungal drugs (fluconazole; itraconazole; voriconazole; terbinafine) are designed to deter the activity of CYP51A1 enzyme to synthesize essential ergosterol (Matin, Chakraborty, et al., 2020; Matin, Hasan, et al., 2020; Matin, Roshid, et al., 2020). On the basis of our study, it could be thought that the effective uridine esters 13â€“ 15 restricted CYP51 enzyme activity by binding with it, and hence, fungal ergosterol could not form. The unavailability of ergosterol ultimately causes disruption of the fungal cell wall causing organisms death.
